{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3467234,"name":"Mohammad Wasim","username":"Mohammad1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/b5ac83/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-03T02:07:00.864Z","cooked":"

Hello, over the off season we programmed our old swerve drive mk3 modules using the YAGSL library with Sparkmaxes, Neo’s, CANCoders, and the Pigeon2. We recently bought and built a frame for the thriftybot v2 swerve modules and made it with neo vortexes run by a sparkflex being used for both turning and driving, thrifty encoders, and the same pigeon 2. We programmed our frame using the example YAGSL Code (didn’t change anything) here:

https://github.com/BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example

in which we simply put our configured json folder:

https://github.com/frc3624/ThriftyBotYAGSL

However, when we deploy our code, we received the errors: [CAN SPARK] IDs: 1, 2, 7, 8, WPILib or External HAL Error: Getting Product ID parameter failed. Unable to account for device-specific behavior differences.
[CAN SPARK] IDs: 1, 2, 7, 8, Unable to retrieve SPARK firmware version. Please verify the deviceID field matches the configured CAN ID of the controller, and that the controller is connected to the CAN Bus.

I checked the REV Hardware Client and found that these specific sparkflexes had a CAN TX and RX Fault, we double checked all of our CAN Wiring and it all seems to be working fine, any ideas as to why this may be happening?
